title: Woman who falsely claimed to be SDIG’s sister remanded
byline: A woman who falsely claimed to be the sister of a Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police (SDIG) and obstructed the duties of traffic police officers in Gampaha has been remanded until November 3 by the Gampaha Magistrate’s Court.

title: Special help planned for schools in difficult areas under new education reform: PM
byline: Prime Minister and Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said special support will be provided to schools in challenging areas through the new education reform. She added that no problem is impossible to solve if the government, officials, and people work together.

title: Venerable Ampitiye Sumanarathana thera requests protection
byline: Incumbent of Mangalaramaya in Batticaloa Venerable Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thera has called on the President and Defense Secretary for immediate security, citing ongoing threats to his life.

title: Obama tells Democrats to push back against Trump’s ’lawlessness and recklessness’
byline: Former President Barack Obama touted Democratic candidates for governor in two states at campaign rallies on Saturday, urging voters in next week’s election to reject what he called the “lawlessness and recklessness” of President Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Fuel train derails, disrupting main line operations
byline: Train services on Sri Lanka’s Main Line were disrupted this morning (02) following the derailment of a fuel transport train, Sri Lanka Railways announced.

title: Maldives becomes the only country with generational smoking ban
byline: The Maldives began implementing a smoking ban on anyone born after January 2007, becoming the only country with a generational prohibition on tobacco, according to its health ministry

title: Former High Commissioner Kananathan Applauds Election Wins in Côte d’Ivoire and Zanzibar
byline: Former High Commissioner Kananathan has conveyed his sincere congratulations to President Alassane Ouattara of Côte d’Ivoire and President Dr  Hussein Ali Mwinyi of Zanzibar following their recent election victories, both securing strong mandates from their citizens.

title: No round measurements of onions: Lanka Sathosa clarifies
byline: Lanka Sathosa has clarified that it does not measure the size of big onions when purchasing them from farmers through its collection centres.

title: New Zealand batter retires from men’s T20Is
byline: New Zealand great Kane Williamson has announced he will retire from T20I cricket with immediate effect.

title: Navy seizes Rs. 5 Billion worth of drugs in deep sea operation
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekara said that more than 350 kilograms of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (ice) have been found on a local multi-day fishing vessel seized by the Sri Lanka Navy in the deep sea area off the west coast.

title: Obama tells Democrats to push back against Trump’s ’lawlessness and recklessness’
byline: Former President Barack Obama touted Democratic candidates for governor in two states at campaign rallies on Saturday, urging voters in next week’s election to reject what he called the “lawlessness and recklessness” of President Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Rain delays Women’s World Cup final between India and South Africa
byline: Rain and a wet outfield delayed the start of the Women’s World Cup final between India and South Africa in Mumbai on Sunday.

title: Six temple tills stolen from Sita Amman Kovil in Haggala
byline: A theft has been reported at the ancient Sita Amman Kovil in Haggala, Nuwara Eliya, where six temple tills were broken into last night (01).

title: Nine people suffering life-threatening injuries after train stabbing in Cambridgeshire, police say
byline: Nine people were being treated for life-threatening injuries after a series of stabbings on a train near Cambridge in eastern England, and two men were arrested in what Keir Starmer called an “appalling incident”.

title: Fire destroys tyre factory in Divulapitiya
byline: A fire broke out at a tyre manufacturing factory in the Horagasmulla area, Divulapitiya, earlier today.

title: Verma, Sharma help India post 298-7 in Women’s World Cup final
byline: Half-centuries by Shafali Verma and Deepti Sharma helped India post a competitive 298-7 against South Africa in the Women’s World Cup final in Mumbai on Sunday.

title: Only 47% of inter-provincial buses inspected – Audit reveals gaps in quality checks
byline: The audit report of the National Transport Commission (NTC) for the year ended 31 December 2024 has revealed significant shortcomings in the inspection of inter-provincial passenger transport services.

title: Four women, including Sri Lankan refugee, drown while playing at Chennai beach
byline: Four women were washed ashore at Chennai’s Ennore beach on Friday while playing with the waves. One of them were a Sri Lankan refugee.

title: 31 youths arrested with drugs at Mirihana concert
byline: Thirty-one youths who attended a music concert in the Kimbulawala area, Mirihana, were arrested for possessing drugs, police said.
